snippet: Mr. Trudeau has spoken not just of policy changes but also of putting an end to Stephen Harper’s often belligerent style of politics and diplomacy.

byline.contributor: Peter Baker contributed reporting from Washington.

abstract: Election of Justin Trudeau as prime minister of Canada is likely to lead to significant shift in tone, as Trudeau promised to jettison his predecessor Stephen Harper's often brusque style of politics and diplomacy.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Trudeau has spoken not just of policy changes but also of putting an end to Stephen Harper’s often belligerent style of politics and diplomacy.

headline.print_headline: Most Noticeable Change Under Trudeau Could Be Abrupt Shift in Tone
headline.main: For Canada, Most Noticeable Change Under Justin Trudeau Could Be Tone
